Jackie also shows you a modified version at the same time of the current motion.  No more excuses - you can do this!

reviewText: I recently started trying Jackie Warner's videos and I must say I am now a fan.  Out of the three I have tried I would say I would purchase all three (I have borrowed these to try).  The abs workout is no different.  I like her style.  She gets in, exhausts the muscle and moves onto another group.  You get two 15 minute workouts here and don't think that because they are short you won't be working.  You will work your upper, lower, and obliques and you will not waste any movement here.  She uses a light weight for some of the exercises, of which I used a 3# weight. She has one exerciser that modifies throughout the routines and Jackie also works out some in between coaching form on the two exercisers, reviewing their form and telling them how they can make it a little harder.Of the two workouts I felt the standing was easier for me and the floor workout was harder, maybe due to the plank variations that you do.  Coming from someone that does yoga as well I can tell you planks look simple, but there is a lot of core strength involved in keeping your body up and her variations are very good/effective.This would be considered an intermediate workout, so at this point you should know that good form to prevent injury means keeping your tummy tucked tightly against your spine and as flat to the floor as you can get.  If you are arching your back because you are exerting you will work into a muscle that is not flat and you also may strain your back.  If you are not able to keep flat on the floor you may be doing the harder variation when you need to modify until your core strength has improved and that is OK, trust me, the modifications are still very effective and you will build up to the harder version.Overall an excellent core workout and as always Jackie's style is encouraging without that boot-camp style that I don't enjoy.  She has a sense of humor and is upbeat without being chatty.  I would definitely recommend this dvd and am considering buying my own copy.

reviewText: Love this DVD and the price is excellent. We have been doing Tony Horton Beach Body and didn't feel we were ready for P90X yet. So I had this DVD in the drawer and we pulled it out to try it. This is kicking it up for us at a pace we think we can handle. We are loving it and plan to purchase more of her DVD's.

reviewText: I did tot know what to expect form this DVD by Jackie Warner, but it is a terrific exercise DVD! Broken down into three segments (Upper Body, Lower Body, Core) each segment is about 20 minutes long. One segment can be enough for a workout by itself, or the segments can be combined for a longer, more intense workout. My only negative comment is that it would be nice to not have to listen to the Bravo commercial each time the DVD is started. But that aside, this is a DVD well worth its price for those who want to get into, or stay, in shape, especially in the winter months. I liked it so much, I bought a second to take with me when I travel.

reviewText: I had never tried Warner's stuff before so I was very pleased with the workouts when I discovered how good they are.  I started out doing the standing routine, which seemed a bit easy since I consider myself intermediate in abs. (I didn't feel it that day) but the next day I could sure feel it.The floor routine is even tougher.  I have a hard time finding ab workouts that really make me feel like I am pushing myself but these do--Awesome...

reviewText: I saw the review from a disappointed Mandie and all I can say is that Mandie didn't do it right!  This DVD is incredible.  I had just read that crunches can actually hurt your back and I have trouble doing them in the first place because I don't have too many muscles to begin with but THIS DVD, with Jackie, I CAN do the exercises - not as long as I am supposed to yet - AND I feel my abdominal muscles starting to develop!  I just ordered another one of her DVD's yesterday.  I like her straight forward style of instruction with no beating around the bush.  She has one person demonstrate without weights which is currently my speed, and one demonstrating a more difficult method.  Both of her helpers show great form and enthusiasm for doing each exercise to the max.  What encouragement!  If I can do this so can you!  Excellent investment.
summary: If you don't feel it then you aren't doing it right!

reviewText: I consider myself at an intermediate level of fitness.I like all of Jackie's workouts --- if you like her as an instructor, you will probably like this one, also.  For me, having two backup exercisers are perfect --- not distracting and shows you modifications if you need it.Per the description, two short routines, no traditional crunches.  Routine moves fast with no breaks between sets and I sweated like crazy trying to keep up.  I was rather worried that being ab only would mean I only got one area covered but the moves utilize weights and --- with the fast pace --- I rather felt I was getting some cardio in.  Wish instructor would utilize music a little better and time moves to the beat but at least the music is decent and has a beat that you could follow if you wish.Excellent use of 30 minutes when you are short on time.

reviewText: Picked this up at Target today. I didn't really care for Jackie's Xtreme Timesaver Training, but I figured I would give this a try and I'm glad I did.  Nancy did a great job describing all the moves and providing an in depth review.  Jackie says in this workout that she doesn't like crunches, therefore, there are no crunches.  I like the fact that these moves are different and not ones that Jackie has used in her other workout DVD's.  This workout has a good variety of both core and ab moves and you definitely feel it when you're done.  I used 5 lb weights, but you will still get a solid workout without using weights.  I would recommend this workout as an addition to anyone's weekly rotation!

reviewText: You don't realize how hard your working your abs until the next day.  The workout really targets your obliques and back, which I hear is how you get a six pack.  You will need light hand weights--nothing over 5 lbs.  Each exercise only last a couple minutes.  You won't notice how hard your working until the next morning.  I highly recommend Jackie Warner's workout DVD if you want to tone up or lose weight.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I have been looking for an ab workout that was under 20 minutes but still very effective.  This video has two 16 minute workouts, a standing workout and a floor workout and both are butt kickers.  This is a workout that is suitable for all levels of exercisers.  Modifications are given for all levels and there is definitely exercises that will challenge someone who is fairly advanced.  For someone who is looking for an advanced level workout, the modifications given would take to a level about on par with (and maybe past) Jari Love and Jillian Michaels.  There are also modifications given so that a beginner could use this workout.  Like in pst workouts, Jackie does a pretty good job with explaining form and the cueing is very good.The only equipment required is a set of hand weights (although there is one exercise in which a kettlebell could be used if you have one).  This workout had a lot of exercises that I had not seen before but that I really liked.  Although this is called an ab workout, this is really a core workout.  The exercises included really work the entire midsection (front and back), not just the abs.  Another plus is that the workout is really enjoyable and moves along pretty quickly.  If you are looking for some short intense ab workouts to add to your collection, this is a good dvd to pick up.

reviewText: Personal Training with Jackie: Crunch-Free Xtreme Abs is a fitness DVD hosted by Jackie Warner, known for her hit fitness TV shows "Work Out" and "Thintervention", focusing on how to tone one's abdominals without doing crunches. Instead, Crunch-Free Xtreme Abs reveals two original 15-minute workouts; one can be done from a standing position, and the other is an invigorating floor routine. No equipment other than inexpensive hand weights is recommended to feel the full force of the workout. Best done three times a week to shed fat and improve one's abdominals, Crunch-Free Xtreme Abs lives up to its title and is highly recommended. 32 min.
summary: Lives up to its title and is highly recommended
Title: N/A

reviewText: I definitely can feel the work I did yesterday this morning!  And I like it!  This is the second Jackie Warner workout I have done (the first being the Xtreme Timesaver Training DVD) and I am a fan.  I really didn't know what moves to expect since the title indicates the routines are crunch free, but I was very pleased with them.  The first routine is a standing workout.  I usually prefer ab work on the floor, but I really enjoyed the exercises.  They were unique as I have not done many of the exercises with other workouts which was a nice change and I could feel my abs working.  The floor routine was a bit more challenging to me.  I actually even had to do some of the modified moves, which is rare for me (I consider myself and intermediate to lower advanced level)!  Even though the moves specifically target the abs, I did feel some work in my quads and arms in these routines which is great!  If I had to give one bit of criticism, it would be that she sometimes starts doing a move while explaining it so I sometimes have to rewind it once I know what the move is, but that is not a big deal.  Once I do it a bit more, I will remember what the moves are right away.  I really like that each routine is short, so I can do both in a day or one of them as ad on to another workout.  This is a perfect compliment to Jackie's Xtreme Timesaver Training workout (which also is awesome!)!  These routines will absolutely tone up your midsection quickly!  Highly recommended!

Title: N/A

reviewText: Jackie's Xtreme Abs is one tough, efficient workout! It will definately be incorporated into my weekly workouts. It is one of the best ab workouts I have done. The standing ab routine was a pleasant surprise. Usually, for standing abs, there is one move that I just can't stand (arms up to one side diagonal, repeater knees). Thankfully, Jackie only had this move in the warm up =) There were exercises that were new to me, which I appreciated.The floor routine is a killer.  Wow! I was struggling with this one, today...I am quite sore.  This routine will be one that I keep in my weekly rotation.  There are some movements that Madison (background talent) struggled with. Plus there is a funny moment where Jackie is talking about how much she loves the moves & she could do them all day....she was doing the move incorrectly. Those were just things that caught my attention. Just wanted to mention them because they were very obvious, and could be confusing because the form is off. Crunchless is a stretch for this, several of the exercises are modified crunches.Jackie does explain proper form well, and reminds you the proper time to exhale. There is a modifier, Jericho, whose form is on target throughout. You will need a set of weights, and a mat.  If you are modifying, you won't use weights. The floor workout has more drastic modifications, so I included what the modification were. In the standing workout, the modifier doesn't use weights. You work your core, abs, obliques, quads, arms.....great multi-functional workout.There are two workouts, each around 16 minutes. You can choose to "play all". I did my best to break the workouts down. Please let me know if you have any questions, and I will do my best to answer them =)-Standing Cruchless Xtreme Abs-Floor Crunchless Xtreme Xtreme AbsThe Standing WorkoutWarm-up (a little over 6 minutes)*Alternating Punches*Alternating Knee Taps - Hands behind head, lift knee up - gently tap foot down.*Grab one weight. Raise arms overhead - lift one leg up and reach arms out toward shin, alternate legs.*Raise arms up (still holding one weight) to diagonal, repeater knees- bring knee up while crunching down toward knee line, or to outer knee line. Switch to opposite side.*Pick up other weight.  Squat down and punch it out - opposite arm to opposite foot, really twist trying to reach pinky toe.*Put one weight down. Lunge position with weight out in front of you. Twist to side, eyes following weight while rotating. Switch legs.WORKOUTStraight Press with Alternating Leg Raise - press toward foot (instead of shin as in warm-up)Split Lunge Flex - Raise arms, bend elbows & gently rest weight on head. Round back, and contract down - elbows to knee. Repeat, lunge opposite leg in front. At this point I am working up a good sweat!Core rotation - Wide stance, both arms holding one weight. Starting with weight on side of mid-thigh, rotate core while raising weight up to opposite diagonal, then rotate back down. Repeat reps on opposite side.Side Bend into Military press - Hand behind head, holding weight with opposite hand. Bend to down to side so weight goes right below knee, then push weight upward into a military. Repeat reps on opposite side.Squat Swing - similar to kettlebell swing, just using one weight.Torso Twists - Still holding one weight,wide stance, keep arms close to side with elbows bent at 90 degree angle. Round back a little while twisting side to side - contract as you go.Figure 8's - Keep lower body stable, hold weight out and make a wide figure eight.Tap & Push -  Tap right leg, back behind left leg, to left side while pushing (both arms holding Repeat reps on opposite side.Quick Cooldown - Reach up and stretch to each side. Wide stance, bend down & drop head towards floor. Stretch to right leg & left leg.THE FLOOR WORKOUTWarm-up* Kneel on Mat, reach up alternating arms* Torso Twist keeping hips stableWORKOUTElbow to Knee - Lay down on back, put hands behind your head & squeeze weight between knees. Drop both knees to left side. Bring in knees while twisting (crunching) right elbow to knee.Swimmers - stabilize back by putting hands under lower back, paddle legs straight up & down.Side Plank - on elbow, bring knee up while reaching elbow to knee. Repeat reps on opposite side. Modifiers, bottom knee down for side plank.Plank Twists - In elbow plank position, twist & drop hips on each side. Modifiers, plank on knees.Quick Stretch in Childs Pose - definately needed!!V-Toe Touch - Sit up with legs, slightly bent, in front of you then lean back. Lift leg towards chest while rounding your back as you come forward reaching towards each toe. (alternating legs)  Modifiers, legs bent, feet on floor. Alternate straightening leg while reach toward toes.Swimmers with Arms - Grab weights. Lay on back and bring knees up to 90 degrees. Bring shoulder blades off the ground. One arm up near ear, while opposite arm is down next to side. Alternating Arms. Modifiers, shoulder blades stay on ground.Burpees - plank position, then get into wide stance. Jump legs in, jump out - keep legs in wide stance.Modifiers - Plank position. Walk one leg in, walk other leg in & walk leg out, other leg out.Bridge with leg lift - Bridge position, bring one leg out (keep it straight as you can) & lift it up while reaching opposite arm towards leg (reach for your toes). Repeat reps on opposite side. Modifiers don't lift into bridge.Leg Circles - Stabilize back. Legs straight up in air & circle legs clockwise (legs bent 90 degrees if modifying). Then circle counter clockwise.Plank with Alternating Leg Lifts - Modifiers perform in elbow plankPlank with Jumping Jacks - Stay in plank while legs are doing jumping jacks. Modifiers on elbows. Walk legs in, then walk legs out.Supermans - Laying on stomach, bring arms & legs up and out. Release, bring arm and legs down & together.Quick Cool Down - Cobra Pose, Child's Pose - Stretch to each sideI gave this five stars because the floor routine was so intense.  The standing routine is a bit easier, which is nice for off days. If you are wanting to get you abs & core in amazing shape, I highly recommend this!!

reviewText: This was exactly what I was looking for. Not a fan of the neck pulling and monotony of traditional crunches, this video delivers on a good core workout. I appreciate the two routines but find that the floor routine is much harder. I think my form isn't totally right on some of the standing maneuvers which keeps me from getting the most from the moves. This is my first video with Jackie and I find myself a fan of her style. So many other workouts I have I never use because I just don't care for the instructor. With workouts just 15 minutes long I put this in my rotation regularly. Just be sure to start with a good stretch and end with your own cool down. Or just frame this with yoga or Pilates like I do.*Apartment Friendly* (Listmania)
summary: It's 15 minutes once a day. I can spare that for better abs
